elements.content: You’re almost finished with the session! In this last exercise, help the MindTrails team come up with new training scenarios that may be included in our future program to help other participants!

Think about a situation that makes you anxious that has occurred for you in the past, or that you worry will happen in the future. Please write your own training scenario based on this situation, making sure to include a positive or non-threatening ending as the final sentence of the scenario.
Keep in mind each story should be 3 sentences - just enough to set up your challenging situation in which we don’t know if it will end well or end badly until you get to the end of the story.
Not sure what to write? See below for an example. Then try thinking of your own challenging situation to write about.

elements.title: Example Scenario:
elements.thought: I send an email message to a friend asking them to grab coffee, but they never respond. I wonder if they are mad at me. Thinking back on the last time I got together with this friend, I remember they don’t check email often and I feel ... relieved.
followup: Notice that the statement 'I wonder if they are mad at me' creates ambiguity.  And that the final word 'relieved' resolves this is a non-threatening way.

elements.content: Now list as many reasons as you can think of for why the ending you chose could be likely to occur for you. For example, why do you think you will be able to handle the situation or what evidence is there to suggest that the situation will turn out positively?

elements.title: Example Reasons:
bullets: This friend has told me that they like hanging out with me so they probably wouldn’t ignore me on purpose.
I didn’t get into an argument with this person recently so it’s unlikely that they are mad at me.
A lot of times people send email messages to me that I forget to respond to, and it doesn’t mean that I am mad at them.
My friend could be busy and hasn’t read my message yet.
If my friend was mad at me, they probably would say something rather than just ignoring me. In the past, they have always told me if they were upset.

elements.placeholder: Note some reasons why a positive outcome would be likely for your scenario
